name: compositionally
content:
compositionally adverb
(MUSIC/ART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the process or skill of writing music: "Dragons" is the most compositionally ambitious track on the album. The two pieces are quite similar compositionally.
in a way that relates to the way things are arranged in a picture: This is one of her most compositionally complex paintings. Compositionally, the drawings in the collection are quite simple.
More examplesFewer examplesThe overture is not as compositionally polished as some of his earlier work. The songs are compositionally innovative, but still accessible.Some of the other paintings are more complex compositionally.

Painting, drawing & printing
compositionally adverb
(PARTS OF STH)
in a way that relates to the parts, substances, etc. that form something: The lower layer is compositionally similar to rocks found in the north of the island. When viewed under a microscope, the cells were compositionally alike.
More examplesFewer examplesThis set of chemicals is compositionally diverse.The rocks compositionally correspond to three different groups.
